de.oth.blocklib

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.oth.blocklib.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleGame

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the game loop and holds instances of every class. First initialize the world with initWorld() and then start the window with start(). Constructor with Configuration or without to get default configuration.
    See Also:
    Configuration

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Create and initialize a new game with default configuration.
      Game(Configuration config)
      Create and initialize a new game with given configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public final void init()
        Creates the opengl context. After the init method initWorld() and start() needs to be called to create a output.

      • initWorld

        public void initWorld(World world)
        Initializes a world with the parameters from configuration
        Parameters:
        world - the world to render
        See Also:
        Configuration, WorldMesh

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        This method is used to update the game logic.
        Parameters:
        delta - time since last call

      • processInput

        public void processInput(float delta)
        To process the input.
        Parameters:
        delta - time since last call
        See Also:
        Keyboard

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the library. Main Loop is here.

      • setBlock

        public final void setBlock(int x,
                           int y,
                           int z,
                           BlockType block)
        Change the type of a specific block in the world. Needs the cartesian coordinate of the block in the world and the type of the block to set. The placement of the block takes place in WorldMesh.
        Parameters:
        x - position
        y - position
        z - position
        block - type
        See Also:
        WorldMesh, BlockType

      • removeBlock

        public final void removeBlock(int x,
                              int y,
                              int z)
        Removes a specific block in the world. Needs the cartesian coordinate of the block in the world. The remove of the block takes place in WorldMesh.
        Parameters:
        x - position
        y - position
        z - position
        See Also:
        WorldMesh, BlockType

      • fillWorldWithNothing

        public final void fillWorldWithNothing()
        Removes every block from the world array. The remove of the block takes place in WorldMesh.
        See Also:
        WorldMesh, BlockType

      • testSetup

        public static void testSetup()

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs the library with a default configuration and fills the world with cubes.
        Parameters:
        args - not used
